title.justification: This title is clearly stated at the end of the provided text.

extractions.description: This paper discusses the use of DataLad, BABS, and Nilearn frameworks to process large neuroimaging datasets efficiently and reproducibly, focusing on fMRI data preparation and Artificial Neural Network-based predictions. It also emphasizes the importance of collaboration in neuroimaging and the challenges associated with large, heterogeneous datasets.

type.justification: The paper discusses the processing of real data from clinical datasets and the use of specific software frameworks, indicating an empirical study.
type.quote: Methods: Resting state fMRI data from 14 different data sets were used including UK Biobank.

name.justification: The main focus of the paper is on processing neuroimaging data and developing workflows for analyzing such data using tools like fMRIPrep and Nilearn.
name.quote: Background: The co-occurrence of symptoms and shared brain characteristics among Alzheimerâ€™s disease, schizophrenia, and autism spectrum disorders suggest commonalities in brain alterations among the conditions.

name.justification: The paper mentions using Artificial Neural Networks to predict disorders from neuroimaging data, making it a subfield of interest.
name.quote: We employ artificial neural networks (ANN) to incorporate resting state time series for predicting disorders versus healthy controls.

name.justification: The paper involves handling large datasets, as evident from the use of terms like 'Big Data' and '39k UK Biobank subjects'.
name.quote: The total number of preprocessed subjects was 47k.

name.justification: The paper states that they use Artificial Neural Networks to predict disorders in their study.
name.quote: We employ artificial neural networks (ANN) to incorporate resting state time series for predicting disorders versus healthy controls.

is_contributed.justification: The ANN is used as a method rather than being introduced as a new model in the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We employ artificial neural networks (ANN) to incorporate resting state time series for predicting disorders versus healthy controls.

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses using ANN for predictions in a practical study, indicating execution.
is_executed.quote: The biomarker prediction with ANN is currently piloted on multisite dataset ABIDE (1k subjects).

is_compared.justification: There is no mention of numerical comparison with other models in the provided text.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference paper for ANN is not mentioned.

name.quote: We created software 'giga_connectome' based on BIDS guidelines and with high quality tool 'Nilearn' that can directly ingest fMRIPrep outputs.
